NFiGIAqOQW10I4PCPkitpg.text: Amazing service amazing food great family friendly place and if the weather is nice opportunity for outdoor seating will eat here again for sure

QtUBH0b86-vBjtZoz-2ibw.text: First time at the cuff. Was very happy.... atmosphere was nice. Restaurant was Small and cozy... we chose to sit outside, I was shocked on how cute and nice it was. Food was great, fries, jack fruit wraps and Mac where the highlight! Drinks where well balanced and worth the price. This was a nice change of pace in downtown Glendale...

eL1vZ9Ihb5F_MbCRHeOHzA.text: Was taken here for a birthday treat.  Having never been, and honestly never knew it existed, I didn't know what to expect.  It has quickly become one of my favorite places to go!  I've taken friends and family and have been back numerous times since.    It almost makes you feel like you're in a quaint little place in New York's Hell's Kitchen.  Beautiful ceiling and decor inside and some of the nicest people working, including the owner who can be spotted cooking on busy days as well.   The food never disappoints.  I've had burgers and steaks and everything in between (deviled eggs and the mac & cheese!!!)  If you get a chance, stop in and grab a bite.  You won't be disappointed!

cQJDoJDhFy8hhO04Gha4qw.text: Last night was the first night I've been to this restaurant .The atmosphere was very nice,small place very intimate. I went at an off hour so it was not crowded. The service was very good our waiter. Was very efficient. I ordered the fish fry which I was disappointed in . The fish did not taste good, it had a metallic taste and I was not able to eat it. It came with french fries and coleslaw the french fries had a nice taste a Cajun type seasoning and The coleslaw had a vinegary taste more brine then mayo,  I enjoyed it. I will try this place once more and order something different . However if I was to judge by this meal I would only give us restaurant a three star rating.

U9IpC2YRV1_uoz5JLhLiig.text: Their brussel sprouts are amazing.  But that was all.  Their fish fry is tilapia.  Our waiter recommended the fish fry.  The worst part was our waiter took our order, then left.  So we waited.  And noticed that the table next us and other tables were brought their food.  Mind you they came after we did and ordered after we did.  I stopped another waiter, he said let me check, what did you order.  Then about 20 minutes later our food came. My conclusion, our waiter left and forgot to put in our order. I was very disappointed.  We were late to our appointment as well.  Not coming back.

TZi7r2HGkqlG-AD3ucdcLA.text: Green chili pork tacos are to die for. Street corn is gold. Love this place, definitely in top 3 for me!

wI8PECPdbpVdSbZdfyxwHQ.text: Great patio area food and service were what I would have expected. Great spot for a nice relaxing afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Mint garden, bartenders pick fresh mint for their Mojitos

cuuvO4p2TEO_5HT5DFlZog.text: I don't get to Glendale often, but when I do I stop in at Cuff for great craft cocktails and tasty food. Prices are a little on the high side, but atmosphere and service is excellent.

LwSRNHcWj8MPuEXzncP8wQ.text: I'm shocked. Where have I been?! There's finally a delicious, modern, affordable local dive in downtown Glendale! Loved everything. The house salad, the Cuff burger, the bread pudding were all fabulous! We'll definitely be back. Not just for the food, but the great service too!

uEbf24o41WSUKy-2dOLP7Q.text: The family and I were looking for a new place to try and we found cuff  and thought we would give it a try. I got the cuff burger and it was very delicious. The meat was cooked perfectly and had an amazing taste. My kids got the Mac and cheese, which was quite good. We will definitely be back. Maybe for there comedy

j7sFRUkzVm56OnUMI0Ii-A.text: Trying new restaurants monthly! I visited this place this afternoon. Service was subpar, female waitress today had an immediate issue and mocked me to the male waiter when I asked for basic items As if she was going out of her way! (It's her job) She filled up my boyfriends tea but didn't fill my less empty tea!  It was super clear that she had an issue and tried to hide it but did a poor job doing so!  She should do a better job at hiding her issues with people of color or just don't work in an industry where you have to work around people!  I will be sending my mystery shoppers of color be careful n mindful of your undercover issues!

Vk0z_T-EHYJmb-UPDX0uyg.text: I really enjoy this place! It's definitely a place the Westside needed. A nice chill cocktail spot. The French cuff is the best. Wednesday is there burger and beer night I would highly recommend

IZvevwkHMrgAjL6b4GRTig.text: I have been hearing about Cuff for months and how great their vegan menu was, however since it is not close to me I had been dragging my heels about visiting. We finally took the 30 minute drive to Glendale and both got Impossible burgers. Cuff does it right they offer vegan mayo, vegan buns, and vegan cheese and fries for only $14. I also tried the vegan Mexican corn it was tasty too. This is a cute bar/restaurant locals seem to really dig it here and the staff members do a great job of making you feel welcomed. This spot has got great food that Vegans and their non-vegan friends and family can enjoy.

lyvBKvQTR-XEQD6u_DNoPA.text: This American style bistro, located in a historic building in downtown Glendale, has a great vibe, delightful owners, attentive servers and delicious good!  Our meals were attractively presented and were just as delicious as they looked.  The owners are on site and interested in talking with their guests.  We were originally referred here by our son and were delighted to hear that we also have other family who know the owners as well.  Our party ordered the Fish n Chips, Cuff Hamburger, Cuff Wings and the Pork Shoulder sandwich.  Each one was delicious.  The Cuff coleslaw was unlike any other experienced and made a Cuff convert of a  Cole slaw non-lover to a Cole slaw lover!

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States

SpFa5V3HhBB7UgQ6DBtOrA.text: Located in what I think is old Glendale center square, the exterior matches the old feel of the area.  Entrance is well marked but still pretty non descript.   Limited inside seating with a bar for cocktails.  We chose to eat outside next to a heater.    Everything on the menu sounded good with some vegan options.  Cocktails are handcrafted to order.   I had the sangria that included bitters, fresh juices and lots of fruit.   My wife had the smashed margarita with a nice crust of salt on the rim.   Baja tacos each has some decent pieces of grilled fish and a Baja sauce.  Side sauces were crema and a roasted salasa.    The slaw in the tacos has a crisp vinegar flavor that paired well with both sauces.  No sides with this dish.   My wife had a fried shrimp po'boy.  The shrimp were very large and with lots of greens.  My wife eyed my crema to add a bit more sauce to the sandwich.  The Cajun fries were good.   I strongly recommend Cuff.  If you go to the Tanger outlet mall it's worth the trip down the road.

U1nd7WE7cXalSyjFJZfvIA.text: Food, ambiance and hospitality were excellent. My wife and I "Yelped" our way here for lunch and it was a treat. The staff were very friendly and greeted us like they were sincerely glad we were there. We split an order of the Fish Tacos and a special hamburger and they were outstanding. Though we only get to the Phoenix area once per year we will definitely make it a point to enjoy a meal here on our next visit.

3gt5hG2SX--F5I1WFZQxzQ.text: Had first dining experience here last night while we watched Glendale Glitters light up. Very impressed with the food. Especially the deviled eggs and calamari. Very flavorful. Also tried the beef brisket which was also packed with flavor. We were at table up front near window which was perfect to watch festivities. Definitely recommend!

SnQ6GGrMElqZJ9yv-Y3ISg.text: We tried the Baja Tacos, Deviled Eggs, Calamari, and Brisket. Happy hour prices are good, wait staff, service, and bartender were great. I'd recommend the Tacos and deviled eggs for sure. I wouldn't do the brisket again but I'm picky. They had a nice IPA on draft and Stone in the bottle. Overall a nice place to visit in downtown Glendale.

-5e9K7CWlUCd6LOZbtmI5Q.text: The group all enjoyed their meals, braised ribs, fish tacos, brisket. We had the place to ourselves that day. Great service, unique restored restaurant. Some of us wanted the key lime pie but were disappointed they had limited slices. Similar to another visit when there was no pie. Kitchen needs to plan ahead. Guests liked the buttermilk pie but not the thick gummy coconut pie.

1rM1qGZe8hEUKixrq1asiw.text: Service was ok.  A little slow starting, but it picked up.  I had the shrimp po boy.  The shrimp was spot on.  Flavor was good.  The bread was not traditional.  Traditionally it is made with French bread, this was more a store bought sub roll.  It couldn't hold everything.  French fries were mediocre.  Also, we started with the calamari.  For the price the serving was much smaller than the average place.  There was  a lot of the coating underneath vs. calamari.  Flavor was fine, but a little spicy for my taste. I had a martini and it was o.k.  Pluses:  Interesting whiskeys/liqours,  neat atmosphere, interesting menu Cons:  Slower service, food presentation, martini taste, closes at 10 p.m. on a Saturday

ciSZ1eSB3K1tTWlhBiZLiw.text: Finally got to visit The Cuff after a long wait. Decided to try it out during the Glendale Glitters event. My friend and I were quickly greeted by the owner. He suggested we sit at the bar so we weren't seated next to a screaming baby- so that was nice & thoughtful. The prices were a little explosive for drinks but the atmosphere was great and so was the bartender.

UHxWdfdoy6sXIYkPuCottg.text: Stumbled across this place last week and headed back there tonight.  Food was fantastic.

K1HyU8E76iLiKUhmWFZ21Q.text: The food was reasonably priced, we tried the burger and the chicken club - both were pretty good! Downtown Glendale really needs more restaurants like this to revamp that area. I gave it a 3, I would rate it a 3.5 if it were an option. I rated it this way mainly because of the ambience or lack of it.  It would be awesome if Cuff decided to offer beer on tap, music outside on the patio and possibly some new tables/chairs outside.

obyI_IZi64NvToliWMC6qA.text: Great place! Great decor, vibe, food, service and most importantly restrooms! The pride in ownership is apparent in every detail!

56maSynMckJi-686ysq53Q.text: Who knew that Cuff also encompasses Zang's? Well... maybe a lot of people, but not me! The husband and I met another couple and their baby here for happy hour (mostly food, come on now). The happy hour has decent food specials, with many regular menu items 2-3$ off. I started with their version of a Moscow mule, which was ah mazing! So so good. They infuse Tito's with fig and add basil, serious legit drinkage. For food, I tried the deviled eggs... very tasty.... the burger - also super good topped with cheese and bacon, yum!, and the pulled pork sandwich - the only thing that was so so. The pulled pork was spicy, which I like, but didn't have much else in the way of flavor. I'd stick with the burger next time (or maybe some Chinese food, ha!). Their fries were also killer.... crunchy and seasoned perfectly. The service here was on point, we had to turn the waitress away from filling our waters. We will definitely be back!

-pL3j6Cc40naMK9jNmmCiA.text: Had fish and chips ate outback good service and food was good. Probably the best place to eat on that street.

smQ2zFE8SkZjasJJ7DuyIw.text: Came here to try a new place to have a family birthday lunch. It was really good. We ordered the calamari and egg rolls to start. Then we ordered different entrees to all try. The honey sesame chicken was excellent.  The curry dish had pork and shrimp, the pork had a sweet flavor to it and was really good. My sister loved her shrimp and grits and my son finished the entire peppered beef dish. The portions were large, we were pleasantly surprised.  The only downfall was the website said they closed at 3 so we hurried to get there by 1 to find out they don't close and happy hour is from 3 to 6. I would definitely go back and refer my friends

VTLn_uoo0GvFy7Hw1VCkQQ.text: Let me start off by saying that I really wanted to like this place. My friend and I always pass it on our commute. A few weeks ago, we decided to try it. There is a small bar with maybe six seats, not a lot of tables and a patio. The decor is nice and it's a really cute place. Some guys at the bar suggested the chicken wings and said they were delicious. We ordered the chicken wings and tacos. The chicken wings didn't have much sauce on them and smelled really weird. I'm not joking, they had a weird smell. And, they tasted terrible. The tacos came plain with some kind of sauce and coleslaw on the side. It was one small piece of fish on a tortilla that didn't even taste like it was warmed. The wine was expensive and it was "happy hour." The food was terrible, prices are high and the only reason I gave this place two stars is because of the nice bartender. I believe his name was Zach. It wasn't a good experience.

EZ-oxfHhd2AEYARgoMlP6Q.text: Cuff was a total surprise.  I have lived in Glendale since 1978 and its the kind of place you dream would be here.  Great food, great service, and very "cool" vibe.   The owner took the time and money to bring the place back to retro time look and feel.  Great for date nights, lunch and the food will surprise the pallet with a huge variety of menu items across French cuisine to Thai.    Make the trip over, you wont be disappointed.  Loved it.

XZxEAm8dAHzXkCDasKozTQ.text: A welcome addition to Glendale.  We really needed some more interesting cuisine over here, too many chain restaurants.  Good food, drinks, decor and location.  We enjoyed drinks and some appetizers.  Will go back soon to try the pork sandwich that I have heard so much about.  We were just not able to eat any more after the generous portions we received at the bar.  We are planning on dinner soon to see Glendale Glitters from their large front windows.

r_nIKDX9vmfccW8M_Lw2pQ.text: This is a darling little restaurant in the heart of old town Glendale.  The service was extremely friendly, and the chef was extremely attentive. The menu is surprisingly brief; a few appetizers, a few sandwiches, and a few entrees. I ordered a Malbec wine which was served chilled. When I asked for my red wine at room temperature, the server replaced my glass with wine that was so sour that it tasted like vinegar. I didn't complain - it's a new place and I'm sure they are working out the kinks. However, no red wine drinker I know of, drinks their wine chilled.  Anyway, I ordered the Cuff Posole, which I was told by the server that people love so much that one customer liked his plate. It was OK. I'm not a smoked pork fan, and it seems almost every dish consists of smoked pork. I'd prefer it with chicken.  My husband ordered the eggplant parm sandwich. It was delicious and the salad that came with was equally delish.  I'd like to see more variety on the menu, more dishes made with chicken, and my red wine served at room temp!

tszLZEqV5xUbQ_kdIyBjcg.text: Sweet-and-sour pork was excellent. The pork was tender, not too much breading and the sauce wasn't too sweet. Also ordered a side order of eggroll. They were light on the breading, crisp,  and the filling was great. Unfortunately my wife ordered the special potato and ? tacos. She didn't enjoy them. She said they were very bland. The Caesar salad was average. We definitely would come back for the Chinese food.

NnlVPVdU3zREN7PNH4lLYA.text: Went here last night. We were excited about Glendale getting some good hip restaurants. Unfortunately it wasn't as good as the reviews have said. I had the cuff burger and it was fine, nothing special. But my husband got the shrimp and grits (which was also fine) but it didn't arrive until after my kids and I had already finished all our food. I understand when waitresses forget to put in an order or if the kitchen gets backed up but usually the staff would apologize for this type of hold up. The restaurant wasn't even busy. After my husband waited 15 minutes for his food after everyone else had finished theirs you think they would have come over and been apologetic and said "I'm so sorry for the delay, dessert is on us" or something to display proper customer service. We won't be visiting again.

tllauD4nH2iZyGnBOdWehg.text: Great Bar, not so Great bar food, Calamari was ok but over cooked, GF Ordered Brisket it was not Brisket was more like a chuck roast that had been smoked and way over cooked Brisket should never need a steak knife to cut it. This may have been an off night because it looked nothing like other posters have taken pics of. I had shrimp and grits, Tasty but the over poached Rubbery Shrimp and Lumpy Grits were a bit of a turn off.  I'm so torn on returning.

Nlsrscxs8DS1zBnD1oT6mA.text: Stopped in while attending Glendale Glitters. Seasoning on the fries was slightly spicy for me personally. The ranch dressing and tarter sauce both tasted funny to me. The brisket Carolina sauce was heavy on the lime flavor. Cole slaw had no flavor, just cabbage. Overall I was disappointed especially considering the prices they charge.  Positive comments: The fish was good, restrooms were very nice & the staff was great!

H6mV6YWPF8NOjkMim5e0Tg.text: When I walked into this place I immediately felt that nostalgic vibe I get when I watch reruns of Cheers! I was promptly greeted but even better the bartender and waitress didn't just serve us they engaged in conversation. Not just casual conversation we talked as if we had known each other for years. I felt very welcomed in there. I'm huge on customer service and they exceeded my expectations! The food was and drinks were also good! If I wasn't drive I'd probably still be there with a Moscow mule  in my hand lol!       I had the fish tacos and I recommend getting the fish tacos grilled (Thank me later)! As I was sitting there I started to pay more attention to the music and I was asking about the songs. I love music in general but I wasn't really introduced to classic rock until the night I came to Cuff. I kid you not I downloaded about 7 Van Halen songs lol! I was up in there getting my groove on! It's a great vibe and a good feel at Cuff you won't be disappointed!      Speaking of not being disappointed, the bread pudding...MY GOD!!!!! Have you ever tasted something so good you wanted to pay double for it? Yes you have in fact you're probably in your car now driving to Cuff to see what this bread pudding is all about! DON'T BE ON YOUR PHONE WHILE YOU'RE DRIVING! Trust me when I say this though the bread pudding is the best bread pudding I've had EVER! I was in the Navy for five years and I've had bread pudding in different countries but then one at Cuff is the Michael Jordan of bread Pudding!       Lastly the owner (I wish I could remember her name) she was such a sweetheart! Her attitude and attentiveness were so good I see why she's running a successful business. She stopped in the middle of working to show me around. The patio area has a little Italy type vide to it I loved it! They also have a live music venue where bands come and play. Long story short I'm looking forward to visiting Cuff. It was truly a great experience!

Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Heaven on my plate aka bread pudding with candied pecans
Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Cheers

tHcSyyWXEcGJAnxkGfOwPw.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch today and got the Brussels sprouts and street corn. Perfect snack.  I wish I could have stayed for a full meal because they had so many fantastic options for vegetarians and vegans! Even jack fruit! That's a restaurant that's committed to herbivores.

usYnzyE9RkVckQ53BfvdCw.text: Cute place in down town Glendale, ice cold AC helped provide a nice atmosphere. I went with the Cuff burger and it was delicious, splurged on Cajun fries and wasn't sorry. They had a nice little kick to them.  I tried the deviled eggs and they were awesome, added bonus of bacon on top.  If I find myself in down town Glendale again I would go back and try some of the pies.

xLEF4xbp1QfH3kSss8tSVw.text: This place was great!  Smaller restaurant on the strip with a nice outdoor patio that is dog friendly.  The menu had both vegan and non vegan items.  The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  I loved the vegan food I got! It came out quickly and it was really tasty! Nice relaxing atmosphere.

Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Brussel sprouts

oRjmj1apwbm-SA42UATf3Q.text: Calamari - very small portion but yummy Mix green salad (no goat cheese) - delicious dressing Egg plant sandwich- above average, but nothing to write home to grandma about.  Mac n cheese - meh French fries - thin, crispy and delicious   Would have enjoyed the ambiance a little more if there wasn't a party if 8 obnoxious drunk women making a scene. Gorgeous outdoor patio. Reminded me of new New Orleans.   Could be a good first date type of place. Small but warm ambiance.  Pricing is average.  Nice cocktail menu.  Service could have been more attentive, seemed short staffed.  Nice bar seating available.  Also accessible from rear parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Calamari in back, mac n cheese with sausage.

pgU_17sBAposDovfTuZ03g.text: This place was phenomenal; from the server to the outstandingly delicious food. We ordered calamari, bbq wings, and Mexican corn for appetizers. For our entrees, we had shrimp and grits, the cuff burger, and chicken wings and cheeseburger for the kid's meals. The food was fresh and seasoned perfectly. This is definitely a place to enjoy great food and great service.

C3FTj281yfFH6nwonqv8Mw.text: One word! Perfection! From the ambiance to the bartender MEGAN to the drinks and of course food! The burger with the pork is TO DIE FOR! We are going back for the meat board deviled eggs and shrimp..gottA bring  re enforcements..only 2 of us tonight with have 4 neXT TIME SO  MUCH  FOOD! Get enough to share around! Try it all!!!

_2tdVuHQycDEplx8G5MqZA.text: I really enjoyed this place! I appreciate this restaurant so much, and the fact that its in downtown glendale makes me so happy. The staff was very friendly, and the restaurant itself was very clean! The atmosphere is romantic and trendy. The character of the building is a cherry on top! Now, the food! Everything we had there was fantastic. I got the blackbean burger, made vegan and it was one of the best vegan burgers I have had to date! The fries were delicious and the brussel sprouts were the best I ever had. My significant other had a burger with pulled pork and it looked amazing as well as tasted amazing, and he is picky with his burgers! Thanks to the staff working last night. You gave us a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Black bean burger made vegan and cajun fries! Strawberry margarita was delicious
Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States

mkJXU97YjudxPUCUmkeWgg.text: Liz the waitress was phenomenal! She was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu! We started with a margarita and a Vegan Mexican street corn.   My husband had the black bean burger with the vegan cheese. The black bean patty is made fresh and to order! This is a must try if you are having a burger! Dont bother with the impossible burger The Cuff is a master blackbean burger mak  I had The barbecue jackfruit. It was phenomenal the slaw has chunks or pineapple in it which compliments the bbq sauce on the braised jackfruit.   We ended with the peanut butter and chocolate pretzel bars. These were the perfect end to an amazing lunch!   Remember try and bring your own Tupperware to cut down of waste of Togo containers.

Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Jackfruit tacos

JicUtoWpcLyabeU12FfF4w.text: We had a nice meal at Cuff with my mother-in-law. We needed a place for both vegans and omnis and Cuff fits the bill quite well! The vegan menu offers two different types of burgers plus jack fruit options (bbq, tacos, etc.). My mother-in-law usually goes for healthier options, but the pork shoulder sandwich captured her appetite. I had the black bean burger, which was good but somewhat plain. My husband had the jack fruit BBQ sandwich. He liked it a lot, but needed to ask for more BBQ sauce. The cajun fries were particularly good!  Service was great - no issues at all.   We probably wouldn't go out of our way to eat here, but it was a great option for a pleasant vegan meal!

nFJXqtuWZv6FV4QAwqDWFg.text: So FULL DISCLOSURE here I am starting a "Collection" here on YELP about my Favorite Vegan Spots in the Valley of the Sun and what better way to start it than with CUFF. This place is OFF THE CUFF...LOL...no doubt it and as you will notice with most of my reviews pertaining to my new "Collection" my primary focus will be on the best burger on EARTH...The Impossible Burger. So if you haven't heard about it yet I am going to help you...it basically tastes like or better than any burger you have EVER had...I am soooo serious. Those that have had it can attest to my sincerity about this slice of heavenly protein cooked well and served with a smile.  Now how it is served and how much it costs is very IMPORTANT... because every restaurant presents it a little differently. Here is how it is done at CUFF...THE IMPOSSIBLE BURGER plant-based burger patty, cheddar cheese, caramelized onion....lettuce, tomato, pickle.   The Cheddar cheese is VEGAN but there is no mayo...so if you want it you have to ask and make sure it is VEGAN otherwise bring your own. Please be advised the wife and I always ask about the cheese and mayo before we even arrive because if they don't have it we will bring our own and we are not ashamed...LOL. The Restaurants give us NO grief about it at all and we have had no issues whatsoever.  The Burger comes with your choice of Cajun Fries and/or a signature salad all for $14.00 per person. This is by FAR the best deal for the Impossible burger considering the Fries are included. So if you're in Glendale and searching for a GREAT BURGER this is definitely the place you want to visit. They also have a nice little bar and despite all the foot and automobile traffic out front, this place is pretty awesome. Eat, Drink, and be Merry, my Friends!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. The impossible Burger

Bl7Kk8qmKyOGL7EH5tRGNQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants!! I frequent Downtown Glendale often and love the intimate atmosphere, and this restaurant fits right in!! The food is fantastic and they have great cocktails and mixed drinks!!! The service is always pleasant and I am never disappointed after visiting!

hfuGZ1Nlo5jDAFqwk4h1eQ.text: Outstanding cocktails in a very comfortable room. The cocktails are creative and delicious. The building is one of the oldest buildings in the area and much of the older details, such as the punched tin ceiling are present. The food is good. The staff is attentive and helpful. We will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States

vQGoNv1ptlojVQZtpZJBPQ.text: So So Good!!!  I am so glad that I checked Yelp last weekend and then remembered it for tonight!!!  I had the Baja Fish Taco, the hubs ordered the Shrimp and grits, and we finished off with Razzleberry pie and I had the Bread Pudding  Oh My HOLY HANNAH it was like being back in New Orleans!!!!!   No Joke I wanted to lick   the plate   We will definitely come back and try more things!!! The salads at the next table looked amazing!

YAx0SL9X7y_5PNrYgmS-2A.text: Food and cocktails were delicious! They offer vegan options as well! We had an early lunch just after noon and were sat quickly and given great service. I chose the jackfruit bbq sandwich and the French cuff for the cocktail option, both were AMAZING!

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States

JyETo-_wu4HTBPY0Rb43bg.text: For Downtown Glendale this is a surprising option.   This is my second visit and the food is consistent.  We went with a large party on a Saturday night and was seated rather quickly.  The food was good. The service was ok. The drinks were good.  The company was excellent.  The ambiance and decor was spot on.    I wouldn't mind going back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States

JnORXS0GbfW-OcjEgQJ96A.text: The ambiance was lovely and the atmosphere pretty quiet.  Came across this as an out of towner on a Saturday night for a late evening dinner at 8.  Staff was attentive and friendly but also just let us be too, not too attentive.  My husband ordered the Mac & cuz w/sausage and a beautiful salad; I ordered one of the chicken sandwiches with bacon and veggies and it was delicious.  Great local beers and simple menu with vegetarian and vegan options.  A little on the spendy side but it was a great date night out.

7MIPYw6D15C3JePacpC7gA.text: Affordable and they have happy hour and taco Tuesday.  Vegan menu items are offered as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States

nksAjVwc0xuZS7gA7dRQOw.text: Located in downtown Glendale. Went there on a Friday night and there was street parking available as well as a small 8 car lot across from Casa Terra on N 58th Dr. The food was decent, however, this was early Friday night about 6pm and they were out of brisket. It is a fairly small restaurant the seats about 25-30 people but a bit of a let down to be out of something so early on one of the bigger days.

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Shrimp tacos
Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Cuff burger

BGC2xHjLGSSpBGmi_c4wyQ.text: My husband and I love spending our date nights at Cuff.  The food is top notch and the atmosphere is stunning.    I'm writing this review because of a rehearsal dinner that was recently hosted at the Cuff.  I didn't even know they were able to do such events.  We were given our own space which included bathrooms separate from the restaurant.  Mouthwatering food, amazing service, and a beautiful place.  We couldn't have asked for more and the Bride and Groom will always be thankful they decided on Cuff.

rZs1o8t0CAQEC4zYy_PKxA.text: Cuff offers some interesting food in old town Glendale for a reasonable price. My wife ordered a burger that she pegged as the second (or third) best she's had in the valley. I had the brisket which had a nice little kick to it.  The meat and cheese plate felt a bit underwhelming. 1 cheese, a couple VERY thin slicers of a couple cured meats. Almonds. 3 pieces of bread. Mustard and some kind of preserve. We had to ask for the olives separately. That meat board is probably the main reason why I'm thinking 4 stars instead of 5.  Service was friendly but a tad slow. The bartender served us and he was friendly but when he had to tend bar, things got a bit slow. The restaurant is attempting to hire more staff so hopefully the speed will get better in time.  Restaurant has a nice decor and was clean. They have a full bar and the prices seemed reasonable. I would wish for a couple decent local brews on tap but I guess there are other options nearby for that.  Overall the West Valley could use more places like this and I'm looking forward to trying more food and hopefully they are able to get fully staffed in the future.

zfH4l7k0uUjxPhZBEV_yUQ.text: The restaurant itself was a bit tight, but the food was impressive. I've never tried Cajun style fries before. Cuff burger was amazing! Server was great and even moved us outside after we sat down because it's nice out.

clqq2p2Lhudr-4b2FW000A.text: Wonderful restaurant! We wandered in here with a big party and they accommodated us without a wait! The lemon chicken was out of this world! Easily the best chicken I've ever ordered at a restaurant. Was extremely surprised and satisfied. Thanks for great service and a great meal!

3qZ-N-BvH2eltsTCHM_k2g.text: Well I asked for one thing, never got it. Server has been rude and sassy since we sat down. Literally got upset when we asked to split the tab after our drinks were ordered. "You're supposed to do that first". Sangria took literally 20 minutes, and the fries were mediocre. Honestly if it wasn't for it being Glendale Glitters, I wouldn't be here. Nor would I come back.

dyjrM4S_OunDbLM-oX-5EA.text: What a fantastic new restaurant!! This area really needs a place like this! I was with my family walking down Glendale Ave when we ran into the owner, Tom. He came up and started talking to us about his new place down the street. He was so friendly so we instantly had to check this new place out. What an excellent decision it was! Immediately upon entering I saw the copper mugs and knew they served moscow mules. Tom told us about their house made fig infused vodka for the moscow mules and we quickly ordered 3. Extremely well crafted and absoloutely delicious!! I could have easily down 3 of those! Since we were heading to Haus Murphy's after our cocktails for dinner, we only ordered an appetizer. We ordered the meat/cheese/olive plate and wow oh wow!!! It was only $10 and well worth it. 3 of us split it and it was a perfect snack with our moscow mules! The staff was incredibly friendly and talkative as well. Tom gave us a tour of the restaurant as well. He showed us the original brick wall towards the back, which was a very nostalgic touch to leave in the place. The patio wasn't quite finished, but it will be awesome once done! Love the beautiful iron gate! Hopefully this new place gets the recognition it deserves and more people come to check this out! Glendale definitely needs a cool place like this! Tom made us feel so welcome and privileged too to be a part of this new establishment!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Moscow mule with fig infused vodka!

jq58O-RS0I1AhShITPtzlQ.text: Ordered the Brisket for lunch and it was the BEST I've ever tasted. Been to KC, Missouri many times where they are famous for bbq and this beats all hands down.   My husband had the Chicken Club and he LOVED IT!  It was so moist and full of flavor.   The service was great and the Chefs were congenial.  Can't wait to go back.

AZa5OtlQ2wJr552l_zsm9w.text: Great atmosphere, friendly staff and amazing food. Loved the deviled eggs and pulled pork. Restaurant is super cute and located in downtown glendale. Highly recommended

zEYLeUZWuN065YY-fFqE4g.text: Great little place.  Narrow and Perfect.  Good drinks.  Yummy food.  Had HH specials one time.  No complaints

DjqGTeN6CKn5rMN1IDX__w.text: This was a great place to eat in Downtown Glendale but they have enough closed their doors, very sad!

aqAKmqsbWUouom9vtUINBQ.text: We have been to the Cuff several times. We stopped last evening for dessert and wine. We had the Japanese Cheese Cake and it was to die for. The best we have ever had. We will continue going back. Love the atmosphere,  David  and all the workers - all so pleasant.  Glendale should truly appreciate and support this excellent restaurant.

im5J2MzGcVxe7tvs2k_yxA.text: Extremely reasonable. Bartender actually knows how to make an Old Fashion, to perfection. Pork tacos were delicious, pork could melt in your mouth. Girlfriend had the burger, tells me it's superb.  Attentive, friendly wait staff, bar tender is second to none.

jMxapaV2Y6Fj4cuowLThzQ.text: Food was delicious.  Service was great too even though we came in pretty late mid-week.    Peoria/Glendale doesn't have many good options that aren't chains.  This place is really refreshing.

hpLzpXPupRLuR-CadspLnQ.text: Not your typical menu...ordered chicken stew and posole tonight...both delicious!  Service very good. Definitely will return.

8peScXpZWtdp4Ngp0PoZYQ.text: I've been here twice so far and have really liked it.  Different take on pork belly and fish tacos, but they are pleasant to the pallet. Good selection of local beer.  Several different cocktails.

mgwHCxsGUSwoBa44aCMjUg.text: Came here not expecting anything special... It was just another ma' & pa' downtown restaurant. The service was exceptional. I asked for recommendations and the waiter gave me them with extra details on how the food is made. I ordered the Smoked Brisket and was very surprised that it was actually cooked perfect and the flavor was right on the money. The Bloody Marry was also very good. Can't wait to go back!

C8J_K_cqzbyx08jdcfM8ew.text: New taste and culinary culture to the downtown Glendale area. I had the Burrata OMG the pesto was amazing looking forward to the dinner menu. The chicken club had an amazing twist and the peach vinaigrette  really complemented the mixed green salad.... Tasty experience!!!can't wait to try the Eggplant Parmesan

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Mixed Green Salad peach vinaigrette goat cheese candied pecans

QqhIzomeXFVXrzNSD0lJfw.text: Absolutely divine! Me and the hubby came here for our 15 yr wedding anniversary from suggestions of some friends to try this place & im so glad we did. We had the deviled eggs which were amazing, the bacon just kicks it up a notch. We decided to share a tequila cuff Bloody Mary which was delicious. They added a bacon slice to the veggies as a garnish and this again was good. Hubby ordered the smoked brisket as the main course which by far was divine. It was so good I almost slapped the waiter. I ordered the cuff posole & this was the perfect amount of flavors mended together. They put pork pot stickers in it and the entire dish was also fantastic! I recommend this place 100%. Try brisket or the posole and you won't be disappointed!! We were seated quickly & the waiter was prompt with his service and very gracious. I can't wait to go again!!! Next time it's the Mai Tai cocktail...

GoERHzOrZdrcVCTki3zrRQ.text: Decided to go back to give the restaurant another shot and definitely glad I did.  Restaurant was very quiet and we were seated immediately.  Wanted to sit on the patio on my first visit, but was too warm on this trip.  The ambiance on the interior is very nice and warm.  The attention to detail is impressive, really like the pendant fixtures over bar area.    Our server was very helpful and recommended the calamari as an appetizer.  Was very lightly breaded, which is a plus, and I really liked the spicy drizzle sauce.  Entrees were very good, I had the chicken club and my partner had the pozole.  If you are a traditionalist when it comes to pozole, this isn't for you.  If you enjoy updated spins on traditional dishes, you'll really enjoy it.  The pork wontons in the pozole were great.  Really enjoyed myself and appreciative of this restaurant in an area that has never had much selection.    As a note, the prices are very reasonable too.

mV7odGKvd4ooOd7_aS4EiQ.text: Cuff has been on our radar for a while. Finally met friends for dinner there. Ordered & enjoyed most of the appetizers. Shrimp & grits - good. Burgers - really good. Cuff is included in Phoenix Magazine 2017 Best of the Valley West Valley cocktail bars - rightly so. Afterwards Went to Off the Cuff for their standup comedy show. Enjoyed that too. It's a good night out.

twgHlB8-q-Fm_86yi2WvUA.text: Amazing! My wife and I love this place! They have REAL top shelf Long Island ice teas. (Hard to find in Phoenix). But the item that keeps us coming back is the grits with shrimp and sausage. It's awesome! My wife hates grits but this dish just works for some reason. We highly recommend it along with the Long Island. It's a hole in the wall but it's a great place to come and enjoy an amazing meal.

N1kQC_sGJ2PY21cBGW-AnQ.text: You have got to try this place! The people were great and the food was even better. When you walk in you instantly get the urban old town feel and you are welcomed by an old school bar and friendly staff. The place was very clean and everything in its place. This was my second trip and I had a great time on both occasions.  Had the Charcuterie Board, Wings (Never had wings with this taste, very tasty) and Barrata (Barrata where have you been all my life) for appetisers. Chicken Club and Shrimp Po'boy for dinner. The dishes came out picture perfect and they tasted great. Great place for two or for a family. Let's help them keep this place open.

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Chicken Club
Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Shrimp Po&#39;boy

ijItvnLvaQZopTZVmKzOiQ.text: The ambiance is very pleasant.  We sat outside next to the herb garden and enjoyed trying to guess the different aromas.  The food was not bad either.  The Mac and cheese with shrimp and bacon was ok and the brisket was ok too.  The winner was the Cajun fries.

Anlg2GsLvxTVY_cj76VLWw.text: Got the brisket ad butternut squash soup.  Brisket is NC style which I like.  Brisket was tender and fork ready.  Soup was very creamy and had pomeganate in it which was a nice surprise.

qSyYdAm57m5qXYd-iI98aA.text: Food and drinks at happy hour prices.  One happy camper.  Ordered two taco plates as I could not get enough of just one plate.  Huge wine pour.  Loven it.

ykJ5mR0iOp2daCDogMNTxg.text: Good food and service.  Loved the cherry old fashion.  Very quaint. Great location.  Fresh food awesome salad and cheese puffs.

j29nIFxGWj9vQaBxgV5kWw.text: Melissa was great and the Barruta was delish! They are combining two restaurants now while one is being remodeled. I got some Asian soup while I was at it. Hot and Sour soup on a cold, gray day.   I would go back to Cuff. Happy hour seems great too. The menus is limited though and it is a bit spendy. It is a darling little place and one of the few in DT Glendale that is actually open around 3 or 4 o'clock.

DJC8dJBRmQ8V4EMxF2K6eQ.text: The food here is delicious. All of it.  Plus there's a comedy club next door, off the cuff that's worth checking out Saturday nights!

X3xUU1yGUuwWRTC-Eghn7Q.text: Cuff is a delicious New American restaurant with a full bar. I ordered the Braised (Short) Ribs with sweet BBQ sauce and Cajun fries. The meal came with a small side salad with a sweet, tangy dressing, cucumbers, grapes, and blackberries. It was absolutely delicious!   For dessert, I had a few bites of Buttermilk Pies with caramel sauce--which was made in-house :).  Try this place if you're looking for something new and are tired of the mundane menu items found elsewhere.

n53jbQxbxRqw--chxWNdqQ.text: Meh.....wanted to like this place. Trendy look, nice staff, nice patio. Had the Cocktail Week special menu. The blood orange Margarita was "ok". The grilled fish tacos were pretty tasteless and the tortillas were weirdly hard/browned. The Moscow mule cocktail was good. The brisket was on the dry side and the mustard glaze was strong. The apples in the apple pie were a little crisp. Service was somewhat slow for there only being a few parties.  *** Update: my friend was sick to her stomach later that night

Bf0NFo3lmZilW4DbZLCzPg.text: Found this gem accidentally on a trip to AZ in June.  We happened to stop by on the very day of their grand opening!  The atmosphere is really laidback and chill.  I ordered an Eggplant Parm Sandwich and it was the best eggplant I think I've ever had.  I was sorry to finish it.  We also ordered the Spicy Sweet Crispy Calamari and it was so delicious. I couldn't believe how amazing the food was.  As a visitor from New York, I guess I was a little shocked to find food that rivaled some of NY's finest.  The service was phenomenal.  Our waitress was really sweet and helpful with choosing what we wanted.  I wish I lived in AZ just so I could go to Cuff again!

roP3YJ3yNXzGJ3VJYEMv5A.text: Went to dinner before Glendale Glitters. Our waitress, Julia was great. She was very attentive and helpful in answering all our questions. Food was good with nice sized servings. I had brisket, my husband had chicken club. They serve brisket with fries. I got a side salad for another side. Food was delivered hot and delicious. Would recommend this place for a quick lunch or dinner. Great food, great service!

WN9mx3O8Zpdcxv94fvzSDQ.text: Not sure where to go with this so I will stay neutral.  I have a had a hamburger and another sandwich here and they were OK.  The staff seemed disorganized both times. I went back a couple of days ago to try the eggplant sandwich and they have closed for 2-3 months for summer vacation.  Say what? It's only the end of April.

-R92NWyLMC3Ae2HWSWxykA.text: Super fun, funky drinks.  A great variety of appetizers,  not the boring basic appetizers. Our table tried several tacos and loved them all.  We will be back and bring our friends for another fun night.

aizxgxZ44m_r0pQXtunOdA.text: Inconsistent  I loved the meal I had last time in this very cute small historic area of Glendale. They still do serve up hand crafted above average cocktails in an old charm atmosphere and offer an American Comfort Food Menu with comfortable prices.  The brisket was so darn great last time I decided to order it.  It was not the same as last time as it was kind of dry. It still had a tasty flavor but was not that fresh kind of melt in your mouth kind of brisket. The brisket did have some fat to it but it just seemed like leftover meat with fat. It was still passable and not bad but also not great like last time. The slaw was ok and the fries were hot and fresh but boarder line over salted. For me they were hard to eat but my husband ate them. I would still recommend to try the brisket because if you hit them on a good day the brisket might be outstanding.  Based on the shrimp and grits my husband had I would not recommend the shrimp and grits. A small mound of grits sat in the bottom of the bowl and was topped with a large amount of red sauce that diluted the grits into nothing but soup. It became just red sauce mixed with grits that got worst from the undercooked poached egg on top that had some raw whites that did nothing positive to this dish. My husband ate it without sending it back. I would not have been able to eat his dish.   I hate like hell to drop this place a star and HOPE that maybe the regular cook was just off that night.  You should still give this place a try when in the area I just wanted to keep my review honest.

AxmPotH_1PNadcXgsvVI8w.text: Downtown Glendale is in desperate need of more places like Cuff where you can get a delicious meal and cocktail in a welcoming and clean environment.  I can rave about the filet mignon I had the first time I came and then I brought a friend back and we shared some deviled eggs.  Everything I've eaten has been absolutely delicious.  Their cocktail menu is short but has everything you need - very tasty whiskey drinks.  The establishment is clean, the decor is casual and the seating is comfy, its the kind of place that you'd want to stay a while and lose track of time over great food and drinks with friends.  So why only 4 stars?  I've been three times and the staff is consistently aloof and working on their disappearing act.  They don't appear to have any career servers, but young people who may be on their first job, which is totally fine but they aren't supervised or given direction.  I think I pinpointed the manager because I hear her ask the staff to do things for her but it's obvious that she's a fish out of water and she usually has a scowl on her face.  I really hope they can get some good help because Cuff is 5 stars in everything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States. Filet mignon

6J6EDJPs10JOfAtM9Wfd-Q.text: What a great little gem in downtown Glendale!  Our family of five enjoyed the eclectic menu of both the food and beverage options.  David was an attentive host who made us feel right at home.  We love supporting small businesses, especially the ones that go the extra mile.  We were seated promptly (we made a reservation), our server was always checking in but never hovering.  Our menu questions were answered with confidence and the food was fresh and interesting.  We had the cheese puffs (yes!), and I was told the salad and fish tacos were excellent, though I didn't try either.  I did sample my daughter's "fish fry" and really liked it.  However, I was the table winner with the old style posole!  Get it.  You will not be disappointed!

-ooV-DV8xsO2KWhst_5nbQ.text: Had an amazing burger and Cajun fries yesterday.  Along with the best bread pudding ever!!   Service was quick and very friendly server.

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States

9ftVA8MFY7Dks7FkuiPS-w.text: As a foodie this place has been on my radar. I happened to be in the area and I'm so glad I stopped by! GREAT craft cocktails! The Old Fashioned is top notch! No joke...in comparison to other well noted establishments this is on the top of my list! Oh and the food is delicious...I tried their version of posole and the spice factor did not disappoint! It had some traditional aspects mixed with Asian style...well done. AND the service is wonderful! Laid back yet trendy environment...l'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States

f1Vd_1S56W4-eJ6orJ2XEw.text: Nice little find, I went in taco Tuesday and ordered the taco plate, portions size was good with lots of meat. Service was good the waitress was super nice

_0NhOvxn-J7YSqDm9Igwog.text: Love this place food is fabulous service is amazing there is always something new and exciting on the menu Cuff is a winner you won't be disappointed

OU1jSbVABFSigYlHqz2bzw.text: What a hidden gem.   We had the Impossible Burger with a side Caesar salad and the Fiesta Salad. Razzleberry pie split for dessert.  The place was quiet enough to allow talking, the ambiance very relaxing and our server Jewelea very attentive without hovering.   The food was delicious. I only sparingly used the lime 'something' vinaigrette on the side of the Fiesta Salad. It wasn't needed. The Fiesta Salad was a flavorful mix of freshness on its own.   Just a delightful meal for a Saturday evening. Thank you!

OL3-pYNLB4hD2n5a4eGsjw.text: Always great food with fantastic service. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The best place in Glendale for happy hour

_3nBuBoXb0M8pK9IXv-CAA.text: Really good food exceptional service at reasonable prices that can't be beat you'll love it! Cool atmosphere as well.

XW1yGa3WFT5e40lrVuh7Fg.text: Wow!!! Taco Tuesday at Cuff is a Taco Tuesday like no other. The Tequila Lime fried fish tacos were absolutely amazing ... So was the fried garlic green beans. So much better than the ones I make myself!! Lol!   My girlfriends and I went to Cuff this past Tuesday. It was about 8 of us... Zach was our server. He was great!! Calm, funny, attentive, just great! We're definitely returning next month!!

8NsRb6Mn7Hpjurel3wsE1w.text: Out of towner here on business and the 4+ Stars is what brought me here. Alcohol: Had the French Cuff and it was nice, not to sweet or sour and smooth. Then the Mai-Tai which wasn't your typical sweet rum drink. Well done. Here on a Taco Tuesday and the Pulled Pork tacos were great!  A few different flavors at first bite then the pork come it and really makes it work. The Tequila Lime grilled fish tacos were a little bland, but nice. No deserts on the menu but they have them and the peanut butter, chocolate bar was very tasty. A small place with a nice patio when the weather is warmer.  I would love to come here and try everything on the menu, it's that's good. Don't let the silly 1 star reviews turn you away.

67ESM-gE0ySd_xqxwcyVOA.text: Never had anything but a great experience here! Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating and drinks and food are always delicious!

8J0Fm2A87RhCMQ_2uYNLJA.text: Had a great dinner at Cuff. Menu was American fare with some tasty upgrades. Atmosphere and service were great. Definitely recommend!

BsikmcNfWJO9IbIf-QjOaA.text: We had not been to Glendale or its downtown in years, so when we had business there we Yelped for a nice restaurant for lunch.  Thank goodness we hit upon Cuff.  This remarkable little spot is right downtown on Glendale Ave, across from the library.  Plenty of very nearby free parking.  Our server was just excellent, explaining the daily specials and making suggestions.  My wife had their Cuff burger and I opted for the grilled fish tacos. Both of these dishes were well beyond our expectations.  My wife's burger was cooked to medium rare perfection.  The beef was tasty and, when the wrong french fries were served to her, our server immediately had a replacement order in and on the table in minutes.  They were fresh out of the fryer, piping hot, and just the perfect texture. I haven't had better fish tacos this side of San Diego.  Three tacos on the plate were just the perfect quantity.  The fish was delicious and the pico d gallo excellent!  Couldn't have asked for a better lunch.  If we didn't live so far away we'd return again and again. This is a real gem for downtown Glendale.  The city has done a great job revitalizing its downtown area, with nice shops and a good number of varied-menu restaurants.  Good for them!!  Maybe they could give some tips to Mesa's leaders (hint, hint).

ale6c0qwFG7cIEeYdKxC9g.text: The waitress was lovely making sure the drinks were full, we were happy, and we weren't rushed at all despite being there a long time just chatting. Food was great and I highly recommend the calamari appetizer and shrimp po'boy. My friend got the chicken club and member several times how good it was. The only thing that was unpleasant women sitting at the table next to ours were having a very ugly conversation, but I can't fault them for some their patrons being insufferable. Next time I come in I'm going to try the shrimp and grits. It's a really neat setting and I'd have no problem returning or recommending them to a friend.

P0UYRNwAzBf7FTVFNFxz5g.text: Food was ok. I liked the Cajun fries. I just had a burger. Burger was good, nothing too special. Had the hefenweizen-$5 not too bad. Went on a Friday night at 8.... it was us and one other group there. Pretty dead, I don't know the area very well, but being a young person, I wouldn't go back at night. Maybe if I'm in the area and for lunch. Says happy hour is 3-6... that may be worth it

VdZr_4uZv-B9w7kGbhytmg.text: Cuff offers a much-needed break from the chain restaurants that abound in the Glendale-Peoria area. Its location in a historic building in old-town Glendale gives it an authentic ambiance. Clearly this is a locals' favorite. We chose to eat at the bar rather than at one of the tables. The friendly people on both sides of the bar made us feel 100% welcome. There's a "family-feel" among the employees, and they clearly take pride in the delicious original dishes and cocktails they've created. Excellent craft beers on draft.  We arrived and had to depart too early for the comedy shows next door, but apparently that's a plus as well. We'll put this place on our must-do list for future Spring Training trips.

XBJg8DazNklH2cxfj4jILA.text: Love this Glendale gem.  The infused cocktails are out of this world!!!! Decided on the copper cup (Moscow Mule). It's so good I won't try anything else!!!! The brisket is not traditional but really tasty. I have also had the Pasole and the fish fry... All very good.  Great atmosphere, cool patio, and reasonable prices. Owner and staff care. We need more restaurants like this in downtown Glendale... As a matter of fact we need more like this on the west side!!! Great job Cuff!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cuff - Glendale, AZ, United States

o2Wj-Yuk9eVT32RuFsqxaw.text: My friend wanted to celebrate her birthday here. We had lunch on a Friday. Our server was very helpful and attentive. We ordered Cuff mules to drink and the burrata as our appetizer. It was so good. I had the cuff burger. It was cooked perfectly. It was topped with cheddar, bacon and caramelized onion. There are 50 billion burger places in Phoenix but this one was very good. I had a mixed green salad on the side with walnuts, cranberries, goat cheese in a pear vinaigrette. I thought I would regret not getting fries on the side, but no I loved the salad. The server raved about this locally made buttermilk pie. We ordered it. Omg I told my friend I had died and gone to heaven. I now have to try Shelley's Bakery where it's made. I will be going to Cuff to try happy hour.

eNZ9AQmeNXrW9C7BIjZj3w.text: Yummmm we love Cuff! Best hidden little Gem in Downtown Glendale!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Best service ever!

btH5qEpPgqkF8ttReW1Qxg.text: Went to Cuff for dinner and drinks before walking around Glendale Glitters last night, and had a great experience. Weather was nice, so we opted to sit out on the patio. Started with some drinks and a charcuterie board, all of which was very good. I enjoyed an HGT, and my husband had an Old Fashioned, and they were both very well mixed with garnishes that complemented the drinks nicely. The charcuterie board had a good variety of cheeses, meats, olives, nuts, and berries, and was served with a flatbread.  For our entrees, I had the shrimp po boy sandwich, and my husband had the house burger. Both were served with cajun-seasoned fries, and we had no complaints with the food. The shrimp in my sandwich were very good, with a light breading that didn't make the meal feel too heavy. We had a few more drinks, my favorite of which was their house spin on the Moscow Mule. They use a fig-infused vodka that is absolutely delicious, as well as an extra-spicy ginger beer, that really adds a ton of flavor to the drink. We were very happy to see a variety of locally-sourced products on the menu, and that the bar staff were using the herbs planted on the patio for use in their drinks! Doesn't get any fresher than that! We were both very happy with our first visit to Cuff, and would like to come back and check out their other offerings, since it looks like their menu rotates seasonally. We talked to several members of the wait/bar staff, and they were all very friendly and personable, and helped to make our experience so positive.  Definitely recommend for a chill date night, or for happy hour!

1oN8tLRBEYd3DDDyp3bXiw.text: Having lunch at this cocktail bar/grill.  Really cool spot. It has a bar & grill look, with a cocktail/diner feel.  The 8oz cuff burger with cajun fries - with a Left Hand nitro brew.  Both were good. The burger was more well done than than it was medium, how I ordered it, but no big deal.  Maybe next time they'll get it right.  But the mai tai stole the show. It's strong- and it comes with a flaming sugar cube that dissolves into the drink.   They also have a small garden in the back patio - where they pick their own herbs and use their own mint for their Mojitos.  Pretty dope.

Kailee was a great waitress. She was awesome to our son. We had a party of 5 and lovers everything we had. We had a couple of fish fries, wings, tempura shrimp and the meat and cheese board. We will be back!

cILo9mZM5kkOGYxOsWv_WA.text: Great everything.  The Mac & cheese is especially good. The adults started stealing from the kids' meals...

tZeT2jQLL68SJx4-u81KLA.text: Good spot in Glendale with a pretty interesting variety of food types. We went for happy hour and got the burrata to start, followed by the fish tacos (for me) and the eggplant parm sandwich (for my friend). I'd definitely recommend all three of those dishes (I didn't try the eggplant but my friend loved it), and I would come back here to try other things as well.

Au1RQonbCCa3oObuveBZ5Q.text: The best  Sangria #43!! Just stopped in for cocktails before heading down the street for pizza. Will definitely be returning, yes for cocktails and to check out the menu.
